Dear Verndale Families,

Yesterday, August 4, the MSHSL Board of Directors met and made some decisions regarding fall sports for this school year. Listed below are some of the decisions that were made at this meeting.
Soccer, girls tennis, girls swimming and cross country will all begin on August 17 with modifications to the length of season and the total number of contests.
Volleyball and football have been moved to the spring (Mid-March through Mid-May).
The spring seasons will be pushed back to a “summer season” that will run from Mid-May through July.
Spring sports as well as volleyball and football will be allowed to practice during the fall.
The above decisions will also affect cheerleading and pep-band this fall.
These are the details that we currently have. We will be learning more in the coming days and weeks about what we will be able to do concerning practices this fall.
We promise to do our best to keep you updated as the situation evolves.

Thank you,

Mr. Greg Johnson
Activities Director

When to Keep Your Child Home from School
Parents often times struggle with when to keep their child home from school. If your child is not feeling well, they will most likely have difficulty focusing on class work and will be spreading illness to others in their class. This sheet may help you in the decision-making process when you are wondering what to do.
General Practice Fever – If the student has had a fever of 100 degrees or more, the student should stay home for 24 hours after the temperature returns to normal (without using a fever-reducing medication). Vomiting/Diarrhea - The student should stay home until 24 hours after the last episode.
• If your student is ill and will be staying home, please notify the school office as soon as possible.
